intro: Hydnora johannis f. quinquefida, commonly known as the five-lobed hydnora, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Hydnoraceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and is entirely dependent on its host for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of woody plants. The plant is notable for its unique, fleshy, and often fragrant花朵, which are adapted for pollination by insects. It is native to southern Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its specialized growth habits and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
